summary: The Oral Health Products Inclusion Act aims to amend the Internal Revenue Code to allow individuals to use Health Savings Accounts (HSAs), Flexible Spending Accounts (FSAs), and Archer MSAs to purchase over-the-counter oral healthcare products. This includes items like toothbrushes, water flossers, and certain medications, expanding the scope of qualified medical expenses eligible for reimbursement. The amendments apply to expenses incurred after the bill's enactment.
